description: Physics 232, the third course in the three-semester calculus-based sequence, explores special relativity, waves and oscillations, and the quantum mechanics of light and matter. Students attend lectures and one 2.5-hour laboratory per week. Offered annually in the fall semester. Prerequisites: PHYS 131 or permission of instructor, and concurrent registration in (or previous completion of) MATH 220.
name: Analytical III
notes: Students in Physics 232 must also register for lab 232 AL or BL.
This course includes an academic civic engagement (ACE) component.
